title: Hojambaz
text:
Hojambaz or Hodzhambas is a <a href="city">city</a> and capital of <a href="Hojambaz%20District">Hojambaz District</a> in <a href="Lebap%20Province">Lebap Province</a>, <a href="Turkmenistan">Turkmenistan</a>.
Etymology.
In <a href="Persian%20language">Persian</a>, the name of the city means "warrior" although it has undergone some phonetic modification. On 19th-century Russian maps of the area, the name was annotated as Ходжа-Джамбас (Hodzha-Dzhambas) and Ходжа-Джумбус (Khodja-Dzhumbus), and in the 1926 documents demarcating the <a href="Turkmen%20SSR">Turkmen SSR</a> as Ходжа-Джанбаз (Khodzha-Dzhanbas).
Economy.
The city's economy is dominated by employment at the <a href="China%20National%20Petroleum%20Company">China National Petroleum Company</a> <a href="natural%20gas">natural gas</a> works in the <a href="Bagty%C3%BDarlyk%20PSA%20Territory">Bagtyýarlyk</a> gas field. The surrounding <a href="Hojambaz%20District">Hojambaz District</a> produces cotton, which is ginned in the city.
